result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Deondrae S Madden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deondrae S Madden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deondrae S Madden was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Conditions:
Expires 3/23/2016
During term of DCA, defendant shall commit no violation to level of probable cause.
If DCA not revoked during term, charge shall be dismissed.
No revocation may take place without hearing before Court and notice to all parties.
Defendant waives right to speedy trial.
Invent expiration date expires, nothing in DCA or laws of State shall prevent State from seeking revocation of DCA if State has filed motion to revoke prior to the expiration date.
Defendant shall notify Clerk of Court's Office within 72 hours of change of address.
Defendant shall comply with all probation rules and regulations of the supervision ordered in this case's other conviction(s).

supervisions.notes: Early discharge at recommendation of agent if obligations fulfilled

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment or attend school in order to obtain employment
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
